author: ductiger
title: BWORKs - Pay As Done Works Platform
description: Businesses and employees need a platform to ensure their collaboration from start to finish. The parties will pay or be paid as agreed.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is a simple idea but put in an elaborative manner. The impact this could have is huge. Bringing and onboarding new businesses and products is clearly an add-on for the Cardano chain but its equally important to retain the existing businesses and developers by providing assistance in every way possible. And I feel this proposal meets such demands in an effective manner. Making sure that the developers are used appropriately and paid optimally is one of the key requirements to keep them on-chain and hoping they build powerful tools on the Cardano Ecosystem. A Cardano Escrow Account is wonderful for making sure all the parties are kept satisfactory and there are fewer chances of the funds being misused and the projects attaining their fulfillment. Hence, the successful implementation of this project would have ample impact on bringing new business owners and also talented developers onto the chain.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers Thang and Duc are known faces to the community and there lies no doubt in their expertise. And the amount of effort that has gone into the detailing of the plan certainly needs to be appreciated. The proposer provides the community and the readers with an elucidated roadmap that includes crystal clear phase-wise goals, resource requirements, risks involved, and measurable metrics. The team provides a very brief flavor of the team and the experience they might bring to the ecosystem. The requested amount seems reasonable and does justice to the considerable workload the team proposes. The budget breakdown looks promising and properly utilized having read through the quarterly goals set by the team. Considering the project to be a part of a huge picture the team carries around as seen in their multiple ventures, I have no doubt regarding the team's ability in making this project a live one.
f6_assessments.q2: BWorks has already looked promising considering the variety of proposals submitted by the team across multiple challenges. They make no mistake in providing the necessary metrics to gain the community's trust. The same can be seen in this proposal, the team explains the KPIs that can be used to make the auditing process prolific from both a development and business point of view. The success metrics and their careful detailing enrich the proposal. The deployment of code over AWS and on Chain are clear indicators to determine the proposal's successful implementation. The number of increasing smart contracts, the number of returning businesses and developers, the introduction and adoption of their token surely aid the audit process in order to make it painless and fruitful.

f6_assessments.q0:
With the challenge "Business Solutions (B2B & B2C)", this is a very interesting proposition. This proposal raised a crucial issue, met the challenge, and was of a relatively large scale. The problem here is "Businesses and employees need a platform to ensure their collaboration from start to finish. The parties will pay or be compensated according to the agreement". I find that in the current situation, people tend to like to work freely, control their own time, and not be constrained and pressured by corporate rules. Businesses want the recruitment process to be more precise, reduce salary costs, and ensure work quality. The creation of this application will facilitate both job seekers and employers. At the same time, it is run on the Cardano network, promoting the system's expansion and development.
Having read the solution section of this proposal, I am delighted with how the proposer presented it. It has identified most of the problems of the challenge and provided examples, specific quotes, and strong arguments, helping readers understand the problem very quickly. They cited the current state of the job market to prove that creating a freelance HR app is essential. They give specific examples to show us that BWORKs was created to solve that problem. In addition, they also outline the characteristics, features, functions, leading architecture & modules, working process... Finally, readers will understand more about the application, helping them see that direct or indirect bWorks' success will benefit proposers, developers, community people, or ADA holders.
The team is cautious in anticipating the risks or challenges they may encounter when implementing the project. Each implementation stage has introduced a relatively complete range of risks and has appropriate solutions to minimize these risks. However, I have a few ideas: can a person accept many jobs simultaneously from many different employers and can track information about which employer they have received. If that happens, is it possible to guarantee the quality of the work? Is there any solution to secure work content from being copied & pasted?

They gave 3 aspects to consider success: from a product development point of view, business point of view, and user's point of view, giving the reader the best overview.

f6_assessments.q0:
Problem statement
Businesses and employees need a platform to ensure their collaboration from start to finish. The parties will pay or be paid as agreed. The solution, Building a platform that auto-matching hires and job seekers then caring for their collaboration till to finished, pay as done by a smart contract. There are now many centralized task management applications such as (WeWork / Trello / Microsoft To-Do ) These applications have a very large user base including both businesses and freelancers. This proposal is aimed at connecting people who need to recruit and those who need to find jobs based on smart contracts agreement, but needing a system to manage tasks and check results is the key issue to ensure make smart contracts are successful. In addition, this system can also be extended to businesses that use their internal resources with proven expertise to work on other projects outside of office hours. I highly recommend this and it fits the challenge perfectly. The proposed team also outlines risks during the development and provisioning of services and solutions, there is one more risk that I recommend to you that is taking into account the percentage of smart contracts that fail. need to be analyzed carefully to update or change the functions accordingly to increase the success rate of smart contracts.
f6_assessments.q1: The detailed plan and implementation roadmap of this project are very well informed by the team, the project will be implemented from the 2nd quarter of 2022 to the end of the 1st quarter of 2023 with the content/functions implemented quarterly. (Project planning and POC / Development of project components / Beta release and market release) in addition, the information added in the attachment about the architecture/structure of the system is very professional. The stated team proposal cost is an estimate for the token milestone, which is very different from the cost proposition in many other projects (which will typically rely on resources, equipment procurement), it would be great for the team to add more information that clarifies the different costs for these milestones. The team has 6 people who are all experts in the field of blockchain/Cardano/Catalyst. Information on the assignment of tasks, areas of expertise, and Linkedin is provided in full.
f6_assessments.q2: The project success metrics are also detailed (Clear and trackable development progress / Quantitative indicators of development). The team will have a weekly report that lets everyone know about the whole process, which will further clarify some of the hard-to-measure metrics. The definition of success is also clarified from different perspectives along with indicators (Success of the project from the point of view of product development / Success of the project from the point of view of business/success From the point of view of the product). user score). In particular, the group also clearly stated the successful KPI of the system operation, which is of little interest in many projects. The adaboys group also funded 2 projects from fund 7
